0.body: If you're reading this now, I mean, looking at these words on your screen, you might interest in our project Darwinia , even want to contribute to us :) Deal, this book is written for the Darwinia contributers!
0.title: Introduction

1.body: Ask a question in the Darwinia Technical Element Channel Ask a question in our telegram group Just raise an issue
1.title: Getting Help

11.body:
$ npm i -g @darwinia/dj
$ dj -v Run the commands above and we'll start testing the relay bridge.
11.title: Easy version

12.body:
$ git clone https://github.com/darwinia-network/dj.git
$ cd dj && yarn && ts-node index.ts
12.title: Hack version

14.body: The first listener of DJ is the Ethereum transaction listener, which will listen the Ethereum and discover transactions interacting with Darwinia contract.
14.title: 1. Ethereum Transaction Listener

15.body: The relay listener triggers every a fixed time range. Ethereum to Darwinia If the Ethereum Transaction Listener has discovered transactions, it'll batch and send all of them to Darwinia for verifying. As the transactions are verified, the relay process is almost done. Darwinia to Ethereum This listener checks the events of Darwinia as well, DJ will send transactions to Darwinia contract in Ethereum while we discovered some events like ISSUING. And this will swap Darwinia RING to Ethereum RING.
15.title: 2. Relay Listener

16.body: The part is a protection system for checking the relayed data, if you run DJ with council account or sudo account, the guard Listener will trigger.
16.title: 3. Guard Listener

17.body: rust crate doc LICENSE The shadow service for relayers and verify workers to retrieve header data and generate proof. Shadow will index the data it needs from blockchain nodes, such as Ethereum and Darwinia.
17.title: Shadow

19.body: Just use the open shadow service at: https://shadow.darwinia.network https://testnet.shadow.darwinia.network
19.title: Easy version

2.body: In case of the content of this book can not solve your questions, you can view Substrate Substrate receipes , the wonderful one The official API reference, docs.rs Darwinia WIKI of Darwinia Run cargo doc under darwinia or darwinia-common project
2.title: References

20.body:
$ git clone https://github.com/darwinia-network/shadow.git
$ cd shadow && cargo run -- run -v
20.title: Hack version

21.body: Shadow service generates proofs for relay system, Ethash Proof, MMR Proof and Receipt Proof.
21.title: Proofs

22.body: The meaning of Ethash Proof is to verify the Ethereum block which is relaying to Darwinia is the Ethereum Block .
22.title: Ethash Proof

23.body: MMR Proof describes the relationship betweeen the confirmed Ethereum block and the relaying Ethereum block, we have to pass this check.
23.title: MMR Proof

24.body: THe Receipt Proof is for the Ethereum Transactions, for checking they are what they are, yep, transactions should be Ethereum transcations interacting with Darwinia Ethereum contract.
24.title: Receipt Proof

25.body: rfc title status desc 0001 Darwinia Architecture 0007 Darwinia Staking Model 0009 Darwinia liquid kton reward Abandoned Dispatch Ring awards for Kton 0010 Darwinia Cross chain nft bridge protocol Draft Cross-chain NFT Bridge Protocol 0011 Using harberger tax to find price for xclaim vault collaterals Abandoned XClaim Based NFT Solution Using Harberger Tax 0012 Darwinia bridge core interoperation in chainrelay enabled blockchains Draft Darwinia Bridge Core - Interoperation in ChainRelay Enabled Blockchains 0013 Darwinia cross chain nft standards Draft Darwinia Cross-chain NFT Standards 0014 Darwinia token migration by cross chain redeem protocol Draft Darwinia Token Migration By Cross-chain Redeem Protocol
25.title: RFCs

4.body: You can download the latest darwinia node from the latest release .
4.title: Download

5.body: $ ./darwinia --dev As developers, we strongly recommend you guys to clean the storge every you run the node, keep our node clean, for example: $ rm -rf tmp && ./darwinia --dev -d tmp
5.title: Run the Node

6.body: You can visit Apps and set the node address to your local node to view the chain status.
6.title: Chain Status

7.body: Don't forget to update the types.json of your node, you can find the latest one here .
7.title: Note

8.body: As a bridge chain based on substrate, Relay System is the core feature of Darwinia. Currently we supports relaying RING token of Ethereum into Darwinia, the process is like: Redeem Deposit User -> Contract -> Contract - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - < Darwinia Relayer -> Handle -> Handle As contributers of Darwinia, we need to know the concreted implementation of the relay system, how could we mock this? Assume that you have already set up your Darwinia development node, we also need Shadow and DJ which are the data service and the relayer tool. Fine, Let's go to the next chapter.
8.title: Relay System

9.body: dj dj LICENSE DJ is the relayer tool of Darwinia, it contains several listeners to handle the relay process.
9.title: DJ
